__e: Actually, I read very well with my fingertips.
I could read to you. I could read aloud very well.
So why do I still read too little for my feeling?
I read what is in your mind.
I read the past, present and future.
I read what's in the letter, end of story!
I read your articles in the Sunday papers - I really do.
I read the paper. I don't like how things are.
Those children those children are always there and then I...except except when I do it Then I see the posters
For a while as I read your letters, I'm a normal person.
That's the fourth time today I done read the tea leaves.
I didn't mean to look so stupid, but I never miss reading your column.
I see from the cards and the hand, past and future.
You see, sometimes I turn the sports page, and I see the society section. And the pictures.

Here. You read it to me. Every time I read it I get first so angry, and then so sad.
